main.name: Daniel Le'Sage
main.occupation: I am a full-stack developer inspired by the intersection of technology, art, and people.
main.bio: Through my years in the outsourcing services industry, I developed a keen interest in solving complex operational problems through a blend of technology and user-centric process design. I'm also a recording and mixing aficionado with a knack for ambience and downtempo music.
main.contactMessage: Have a project in mind? Let's talk!

resume.skillmessage: I have extense experience with modern web development technologies, web architecture design and patterns, and cloud platforms like GCP and AWS.

work.title: Director of Engineering
work.description: I work with a team of over 30 developers tasked at building enterprise products, as well as a small fleet of SaaS offerings. My role consists of supporting PartnerHero's Product team through technical guidance, engineering management, and cross-functional implementation across a number of our development projects.

work.title: Systems & Optimization Manager
work.description: During my time as the Systems & Optimization manager, I oversaw 4 development teams who were responsible for the buildout of PartnerHero's core tech stack. This included two Chrome extensions, a number of small scale progressive web applications, and various Slack applications that were used by Operations, Finance, and Human Resources.

work.title: Operations Analyst
work.description: As an Operations Analyst, I was responsible for the collection, transformation, maintenance, and exposure of operational, financial, and employee-centric data. I worked with a team of Operations Analysts building replicable reports for internal and client audiences.

work.title: Web Developer
work.description: I built a small progressive web application meant at streamlining Trebol Tec's inventory management process. This was a solo project with guidance from management.

testimonials.text: I am drawn towards the premise that software is meant to facilitate the life of any one person who uses it. Software developers are merely mediators between users and their needs.
